parameters.jsonBody:
=[
  {
    "keyword": "{{ $('Get Job').item.json["Primary Keywords"] }}",
    "location_name": "{{ $('Get Job').item.json["Location Name"] }}",
    "language_name": "{{ $('Get Job').item.json["Language Name"] }}",
    "depth": 3,
    "include_seed_keyword": false,
    "include_serp_info": false,
    "ignore_synonyms": false,
    "include_clickstream_data": false,
    "replace_with_core_keyword": false,
    "limit": 100
  }
]

=[
  {
    "keyword": "{{ $('Get Job').item.json["Primary Keywords"] }}",
    "location_name": "{{ $('Get Job').item.json["Location Name"] }}",
    "language_name": "{{ $('Get Job').item.json["Language Name"] }}",
    "include_seed_keyword": false,
    "include_serp_info": false,
    "ignore_synonyms": false,
    "include_clickstream_data": false,
    "exact_match": false,
    "limit": 100
  }
]

=[
  {
    "keywords": [
      "{{ $('Get Job').item.json["Primary Keywords"] }}"
    ],
    "location_name": "{{ $('Get Job').item.json["Location Name"] }}",
    "language_name": "{{ $('Get Job').item.json["Language Name"] }}",
    "include_serp_info": false,
    "closely_variants": false,
    "ignore_synonyms": false,
    "include_clickstream_data": false,
    "limit": 100
  }
]

assignments.name: Score
assignments.value: ==0.4*H{{$itemIndex+2}}/MAX(H:H) + IF( AND(B{{$itemIndex+2}}="", J{{$itemIndex+2}}=""), 0, 0.4*(1 - IF(B{{$itemIndex+2}}<>"", B{{$itemIndex+2}}, J{{$itemIndex+2}})/100) ) + 0.2*I{{$itemIndex+2}}/MAX(I:I)

parameters.jsonBody:
={
  "aggressivePrune": false,
  "clickElementsCssSelector": "[aria-expanded=\"false\"]",
  "clientSideMinChangePercentage": 15,
  "crawlerType": "playwright:adaptive",
  "debugLog": false,
  "debugMode": false,
  "expandIframes": true,
  "ignoreCanonicalUrl": false,
  "keepUrlFragments": false,
  "maxCrawlDepth": 0,
  "proxyConfiguration": {
    "useApifyProxy": true,
    "apifyProxyGroups": [
      "RESIDENTIAL"
    ],
    "apifyProxyCountry": "US"
  },
  "readableTextCharThreshold": 100,
  "removeCookieWarnings": true,
  "removeElementsCssSelector": "nav, footer, script, style, noscript, svg, img[src^='data:'],\n[role=\"alert\"],\n[role=\"banner\"],\n[role=\"dialog\"],\n[role=\"alertdialog\"],\n[role=\"region\"][aria-label*=\"skip\" i],\n[aria-modal=\"true\"]",
  "renderingTypeDetectionPercentage": 10,
  "respectRobotsTxtFile": true,
  "saveFiles": false,
  "saveHtml": false,
  "saveHtmlAsFile": false,
  "saveMarkdown": true,
  "saveScreenshots": false,
  "startUrls": [
    {
      "url": "{{ $json.url }}",
      "method": "GET"
    }
  ],
  "useSitemaps": false,
  "includeUrlGlobs": [],
  "excludeUrlGlobs": [],
  "maxCrawlPages": 9999999,
  "initialConcurrency": 0,
  "maxConcurrency": 200,
  "initialCookies": [],
  "maxSessionRotations": 10,
  "maxRequestRetries": 5,
  "requestTimeoutSecs": 60,
  "minFileDownloadSpeedKBps": 128,
  "dynamicContentWaitSecs": 10,
  "waitForSelector": "",
  "softWaitForSelector": "",
  "maxScrollHeightPixels": 5000,
  "keepElementsCssSelector": "",
  "htmlTransformer": "readableText",
  "maxResults": 9999999
}

parameters.jsonSchemaExample:
{
  "contentStrength": 72,
  "contentGaps": [
    "No local neighborhood guides beyond hotel listings",
    "Missing seasonal tips or best-times-to-visit advice",
    "Lacks user-submitted photos or testimonial snippets"
  ],
  "notes": [
    "Add a map of Shinjuku with pins for each hotel",
    "Include a price-vs-amenities comparison table",
    "Embed a short FAQ on booking best practices"
  ],
  "contentGoal": "Informational/Transactional – help travelers discover and book Shinjuku hotels",
  "contentType": "Listicle (Top 10 Hotels)",
  "targetAudience": "International and domestic travelers planning a stay in Shinjuku, from budget backpackers to luxury seekers",
  "toneAndStyle": "Friendly, concise, authoritative; use bullet lists and callouts for quick scanning"
}

parameters.text:
=You are a content strategist. Analyze the following article and return a JSON object EXACTLY with these keys:
- contentStrength: a score from 0–100
- contentGaps: an array of up to 5 missing topics or weaknesses
- notes: editorial suggestions (bullets)
- contentGoal: the search intent / goal of this page
- contentType: article type (how-to, listicle, comparison, etc.)
- targetAudience: a short persona description
- toneAndStyle: recommended tone & style guidelines

Article Markdown:
 {{ $json.markdown }}

parameters.jsonSchemaExample:
{
    "Keyword": "tokyo hotels shinjuku",
    "Content Goal": "Help travelers identify and book the ideal hotel in Shinjuku by providing detailed comparisons of amenities, location, pricing, and user reviews.",
    "Content Type": "Listicle",
    "Target Audience": "Travelers planning a trip to Shinjuku, Tokyo seeking accommodation options",
    "Search Intent": "Transactional",
    "Recommended Word Count": "1,200–1,500",
    "Tone & Style": "Informative and engaging with a focus on clarity and ease of navigation",
    "Unique Angle": "Combines granular amenity breakdowns, authentic user testimonials, interactive map embeds and alerts for current deals to outperform existing listicles",
    "Suggested Sections": [
      "H2: Top 10 Hotels in Shinjuku at a Glance",
      "H3: Hotel Name • Price Range • Rating • Key Perks"
    ],
    "CTAs Needed": "Interactive map showing hotel locations; image gallery of each property; “Book Now” affiliate CTA buttons; comparison table",
    "Linked SERP Analysis": "See Master SERP Analysis tab for detailed notes on top-ranking pages",
    "Notes": "Include sections for budget, mid-range and luxury picks; plan for dynamic price updates; embed a simple booking form or affiliate link"
}

{
  "Keyword": "tokyo hotels shinjuku",
  "Slug": "top-10-hotels-shinjuku-guide-2025",
  "Meta Title": "Top 10 Shinjuku Hotels 2025 | Ultimate Booking Guide",
  "Meta Description": "Discover the 10 best hotels in Shinjuku with detailed reviews, amenities, maps, and current deals to book your ideal stay in Tokyo.",
  "Table of Contents": "- [Top 10 Hotels in Shinjuku at a Glance](#top-10-hotels-in-shinjuku-at-a-glance)\n- [In-Depth Hotel Reviews and Amenities](#in-depth-hotel-reviews-and-amenities)\n- [How to Choose the Right Hotel](#how-to-choose-the-right-hotel)\n- [Nearby Attractions and Accessibility](#nearby-attractions-and-accessibility)\n- [Current Offers, Discounts & Booking Tips](#current-offers-discounts--booking-tips)\n- [Frequently Asked Questions](#frequently-asked-questions)",
  "Introduction": "Planning a trip to the heart of Tokyo? Shinjuku offers a perfect blend of neon-lit entertainment, serene parks, and world-class shopping. Choosing the right hotel can make or break your visit—whether you’re chasing nightlife in Kabukicho or seeking peace near Shinjuku Gyoen. In this guide, we’ve handpicked the top 10 hotels in Shinjuku for 2025, complete with amenity breakdowns, user testimonials, an interactive map, and insider booking tips to help you secure the best deal for your stay.",
  "Content": [
    {
      "Title": "Top 10 Hotels in Shinjuku at a Glance",
      "Draft": "| Hotel Name | Price Range (per night) | Rating (★) | Key Perks |\n|-------------------------------------------|-------------------------|------------|-------------------------------------|\n| HOTEL GROOVE SHINJUKU                     | $120–$200               | 4.5        | Rooftop bar, gym, free Wi-Fi        |\n| Keio Plaza Hotel Tokyo                    | $150–$250               | 4.4        | Multiple dining options, pool       |\n| Hotel Gracery Shinjuku                    | $100–$180               | 4.2        | Godzilla rooftop, modern rooms      |\n| APA Hotel & Resort Nishishinjuku-Gochome  | $80–$140                | 4.0        | Onsen, compact rooms, free breakfast|\n| Shinjuku Washington Hotel - Main Building | $110–$190               | 4.1        | Business center, subway access      |\n| Hotel Yuni Star-Club                      | $90–$160                | 4.0        | Cozy interiors, close to Kabukicho  |\n| Rosenheim Tokyo Shinjuku                  | $130–$220               | 4.3        | Boutique style, live music lounge   |\n| BELLUSTAR TOKYO                           | $140–$230               | 4.4        | Panoramic city views, bar           |\n| FLOWER TERRACE Higashi Shinjuku           | $95–$170                | 4.1        | Garden terrace, quiet location      |\n| Hotel Pasela Living                       | $105–$185               | 4.2        | Karaoke rooms, family suites        |",
      "Image Prompt": "Interactive map of Shinjuku showing hotel locations",
      "Words": 1000
    },
    {
      "Title": "In-Depth Hotel Reviews and Amenities",
      "Draft": "HOTEL GROOVE SHINJUKU**  \nNestled in East Shinjuku, HOTEL GROOVE features bright, music-themed rooms. Highlights include a rooftop bar with skyline views, 24/7 gym access, and complimentary high-speed Wi-Fi. Guests rave about the friendly staff and modern décor.\n\n**Keio Plaza Hotel Tokyo**  \nA Shinjuku landmark since 1971, Keio Plaza offers multiple restaurants (including a Michelin-recognized French bistro), an indoor pool, and an executive lounge. Perfect for families and business travelers.\n\n**Hotel Gracery Shinjuku**  \nFamous for its Godzilla head on the terrace, Gracery provides spacious rooms with blackout curtains, a 24-hour convenience store onsite, and direct access to major entertainment districts.\n\n*…detailed write-ups for the remaining hotels…*",
      "Image Prompt": "Lobby of HOTEL GROOVE SHINJUKU",
      "Words": 1000
    }
  ],
  "Conclusion": "With its electrifying energy and endless conveniences, Shinjuku is a must-visit destination—and the right hotel sets the tone for your Tokyo adventure. Use this guide to weigh amenities, location, and deals, then book confidently knowing you’ve got insider tips on transport, attractions, and exclusive offers. Ready to pack your bags? Secure your Shinjuku stay today and experience the best of Tokyo!",
  "Notes": "Update deals monthly; verify pricing and availability before publishing.",
  "Internal Link Targets": [
    "/tokyo-travel-guide",
    "/japan-hotel-amenities",
    "/booking-tips"
  ],
  "External References": [
    "https://www.japan.travel/en/spot/1009/",
    "https://www.japan-guide.com/e/e3015.html"
  ]
}

parameters.text:
=You are the formatting agent, convert the following content into HTML for my WordPress post without changing any content: Title: {{ $('Get Master List4').item.json['Meta Title'] }} Table of Content (should add in-page anchor link to the related section): {{ $('Get Master List4').item.json['Table of Contents'] }} Introduction: {{ $('Get Master List4').item.json.Introduction }} Content: {{ JSON.stringify($json.data) }} Conclusion: {{ $('Get Master List4').item.json.Conclusion }} For the image, please use following format to improve the speed:

Remember KEEP ALL THE INPUT CONTENT, DO NOT REMOVE OR REPHRASE, you are just a formatter. Skip title in content as we already put it in Wordpress title. You should return only the content inside in HTML format, now return the full article with all the sections:

parameters.content: ## We will call multiple DataForSEO endpoints to get all types of keywords.
## Remove duplicated keywords and pass them to AI to filter out unrelated keywords, like "w hotel" in "Tokyo Hotel" (Tokyo does not have w hotel").
## Add a scoring forumla for ranking keywords as an internal reference.
## Some keywords are missing volume and difficulty data, which are required for score calculation. We need to fetch this information again for those specific keywords.
## Get 1 Keyword from the Master list and get first-page SERP result.
## Use Apify to get the website content and use GPT to analysis the content.
## Retrieve SERP data for keywords from the master list, including all ranking entries. Then, use GPT to generate a content brief and article outline based on the analysis.
## Generate an image using OpenAI's image generation API, then resize and convert it to JPEG format to optimize file size.
## We will also retrieve existing articles from our content library to identify internal linking opportunities.
## Changing the Post Status to 'Ready' will automatically publish the post, overriding the existing WordPress post content with the new Post Content.

parameters.text:
=I've done a SEO research, here's the result:

{{ JSON.stringify($json.data) }}

Now generate a Content Brief with the following columns:

Keyword: The primary keyword for the article (must match with the Master sheet)
Content Goal: Purpose of the article (e.g., educate, convert, rank for question intent)
Content Type: Format: Guide, Listicle, Comparison, Tutorial, etc.
Target Audience: Who the content is for (e.g., beginners, marketers, DIYers, runners)
Search Intent: Informational, Commercial, Transactional, Navigational
Recommended Word Count: Based on the topic, estimate a long-form article word count, target to be at least 3000 but not more than 8000 words, return an absolute number
Tone & Style: Informational, persuasive, conversational, expert, etc.
Unique Angle: What makes your version better (e.g., adds visuals, expert quotes, new data)
Suggested Sections: Draft H2s/H3s (based on SERP analysis + GPT suggestions), sections count should relevant to words count, each section should be at least 100 words but not more than 1000 words
CTAs Needed: Diagrams, product embeds, forms, signups, affiliate links, etc.
Linked SERP Analysis: Optional: hyperlink to row or note in SERP Analysis tab
Notes: Additional comments, reminders, or ideas

return in JSON
